summary: This bill, the Better Collaboration, Accountability, and Regulatory Enforcement for Animals Act (Better CARE for Animals Act) of 2025, amends the Animal Welfare Act. It expands the enforcement capabilities of the Attorney General, allowing them to bring civil actions, seize and forfeit animals, and issue warrants related to violations. It also updates definitions, clarifies regulations regarding licenses, investigations, and civil penalties, including rewards for care of seized animals. Additionally, it directs the Secretary of Agriculture and the Attorney General to develop a memorandum of understanding to facilitate these enforcement actions.
